page.title: 07CULFEIGHTRIN CHURCH
page.content: ONE WALL REMAINS FROM THE CHURCH WHICH CONTAINS AN EAST WINDOW.THE RUIN IS ON STEEP LAND OVERLOOKING BALLYCASTLE PIER AND THE AREA COVERED BY OUR SQUARE.THE RUIN IS ON MAGHERINTEMPLE ESTATE.THE ARCHED WINDOW IS SHAPED LIKE A CROWN AND IS STILL QUITE ACCURATE.THE WINDOW CAN BE FOUND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE WALL AND IS PARTLY COVERED IN GRASS AND FERN.THE COLOURED STONES ARE FITTED CLOSELY TOGETHER,BUT ARE NOT ALL THE SAME SIZE.BELOW THE WINDOW THE STONES BECOME VERY NARROW WHICH MUST HAVE BEEN A TABLE OF SOME SORT AT ONE TIME.THE WALL IS ALSO COVERED IN GRASS,FERN AND MOSS. ONE STACK ALSO STANDS WHICH WAS PART OF A SIDE WALL.AS THE CHURCH IS OUT IN THE OPEN,IT WAS USED BY NEARBY VILLAGERS.
